name: Furry-octo-tribble
body:
# Ryan's assignment for Guns, Germs and Steel

***
### Arny's History class

***
1. The rate of spread along Eurasia's east-west axis was on average 0.7 miles per year from the fertile crescent to the Indus river valley. The rate in the Americas, with their north-south axis was less than 0.5 miles per year.
2. The climate of Eurasia at the same lattitudes as the fertile crescent was much the same as it, and therefore the crops were able to spread very rapidly; they did not have to adapt to a new climate. They were also extremely useful.
3. The crops had to adapt to the new climate, and therefore were not able to move as quickly.

***
Does this work as a way of turning in homework, Arny?
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
